peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the oldest corningware design?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The first pattern produced was Wheat; it was test marketed in 1958. It didn't test well with potential customers, and was dropped in favor of Blue Cornflower.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: CorningWare - Wikipedia

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much is La Marjolaine Corningware worth?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: A set of 1960 to 1970s Corning Ware casserole dishes with Pyrex lids in the Spice of Life (la marjolaine) pattern have a value of $15 to $25 each. There is currently a viral Facebook share and internet article that is falsely telling people that these are worth $10,000.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: I have some Corning Ware with the La Marjolaine, written on it, besides ...

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What year was Blue Cornflower Corningware?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Manufactured in Corning, New York, the first collection launched in 1958. They were dishwasher-safe and could withstand high temperatures for oven and stovetop use. The original run of Blue Cornflower Corningware was made of Pyroceram, a NASA-graded synthetic glass-ceramic.
